climbs.name: The Weevil
climbs.fa: Anders Zway, Tony Furman, Chris May

content.description: This route is the right route of the two. It climbs up the long black water streak. Starts up a slightly grungy crack where there is a bolt. You can easily see this bolt from the ground. Clip this bolt and move up and over a slight bulge. Easier climbing leads to a horizontal crack where you can get gear. Climb 20-25 ft to reach the next and last gear placement. Its a small crack. From here its a long run to the anchors. The crux moves are well above you last gear so be focused.
content.protection:
1 bolt, Double TCU set would be good. Small nuts from #3-#10 BD. Runners. Anchors at the top. 

  Not sure if you can do this with a 60m rope,so bring a 70m to be safe.
content.location: The right route of the two.

climbs.name: Lesser of Two Weevils
climbs.fa: Anders Zway, Tony Fuhrman, Brian Grisham

content.description:
This routes is the left of the two routes. It starts right of a small dihedral capped by a small roof 15 ft up. Start to the right of this up a small crack. You can get 'ok' gear before getting to the first bolt, which is kinda hard to see from the ground. 

  Climbing past the first bolt and move into the large water groove left. Follow this to the Anchors.
content.protection:
4 or 5 bolt and Anchors. Maybe some marginal finger sized gear here and there to reduce the runouts. Runners for the gear might be good. 

  We did this with a 70M rope. Not sure if you can do it with a 60M, so bring a 70M to be safe. 

  Soft R rating for this if you don't place gear.

content.description: This is wall is able to be seen from the Linda Vista trail head parking lot. It faces north and is in the shade till late in the afternoon. The rock is a little grainy.
